title: Learning and Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNHCR (Budapest)
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview process was transparent and fair. The questions were part of a competency-based interview and at the end I was also assigned a task (Excel - Pivot table).
Interview Questions: Tell me a challenging situtation in professional context and how you dealt with it.

title: PAYROLL Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNHCR (Budapest) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: We had to pass a written test to get selected for the personal interview with 3 managers. The written test contained various logic questions and had an attention span test as well. We had to write a formal email in Word and calculate some benefits in Excel. The personal interview was easier, I felt no pressure.
Interview Questions: What Payroll systems do you work with and how well you know them? How do you manage high-pressure and high workload?

title: G5 Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UNHCR in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was for a temp position, therefore the interview process was short. They experienced some technical issues so the interview itself started  with 15 mins delay.  Two interviewers - tell the truth they have not left a mark…
Interview Questions: What is the difference between screening and short listing.

title: Admin associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNHCR in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Typical competency based interview, 3 panel members, each asked questions. Interview was preceded by a written test. Was not a bad experience but it took ages to hear back from them, by that time I had two other offers.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had several competing tasks and tigt deadlines for them. What did you do?

title: Procurement Internship Interview
Interview Descriptions:
I have not had the interview yet, once I do I'll definitely come back to edit this.
But for now, I applied on their official website and they email me to come for an interview.
The job is as a procurement intern in the headquaters
Interview Questions: What is my weakness when working with people?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: Phone call. Online application(very long process). Interview with 3 interviewers. There was a written exam on the same day as the interview, with basic tasks: answer an email, so some calculations in excel, etc.
Interview Questions: Competency based questions, some general questions about what you know of UNHCR.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNHCR (Budapest) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview with 3 representatives of the organization from the local office and headquarters, via Skype conference call. Prior to that I applied via UNHCR Talent Pool. The waiting time was about one month, after which I got an email with the invitation to the interview.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest challenge that you faced during the research and how did you address it?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNHCR in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very long and overly complicated process, the interview questions are designed for multinational companies rather than a humanitarian organisation and were very generic. This is specific to my duty station, but the interviewers did not seem to care too much about my answers, and I was chosen based on my CV as I learnt later.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a conflict in a workplace?

title: Finance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at UNHCR (Budapest) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy selection process, which started with psychometric assessment, followed by competency-based interview (few months later) and then followed by functional test. Only candidates that passed each stage of the recruitment process were invited to the next.
Interview Questions: Please describe any skills and competencies you have, and which may be of particular relevance to this position

title: Public Information Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UNHCR
Interview Descriptions: Very standard, combination of competency-based and technical questions. Not easy and not too difficult either. General questions on background, why interested in the position, why the best candidate, what would be challenging, what I would do in the first month, positive-negative traits, etc. Other questions focused on the specific tasks in the position and how I would approach them.
Interview Questions: What are your key skills and experience relevant for this position?

title: Public Information Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UNHCR
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions about qualifications, future career plans, skills then specific questions about issues pertaining refugees. Interview was in English and in the country's language. It was also followed by a test regarding the skills in social media.
Interview Questions: Why do you would like to work for us?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UNHCR (Budapest) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Since I lived in Texas at the time of the interview process, we conducted our conversation via Skype. Also, since it was just an internship, the process was very easy and straightforward. My skills and educational background were the most important aspects of the interview. After landing the internship, I was required to undergo a physical and sign a contract for the 3 month duration of the internship.
Interview Questions: How has your education prepared you for an internship with the UNHCR?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UNHCR (Budapest)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for an online job advertisement, completed a special form available at UNHCR website and attached a cover letter. I got a phone call about 1 month later, than was invited for an interview and test. The interview was about 1 hour long, three persons, an assistant, an HR officer and another lady. Fully english, competent based interview, just their questions, nothing being asked from my CV. It was devastating so to say, but I felt it turned out good. They never called me though, and two months passed since, tried to call them, but they mentioned technical problems..... They might call me, but you know what this means...
Interview Questions: Can you give me an example form your previous carrier, when you had to solve an internal conflict in your team, what did you do?
